Foreword

The Georgia Manufacturin g Director y is a completely revised and expa nded edition of a previous indu strial directory issued by the Department of Commerce in 1958.

In the present ed ition, for the first time , Georgia manufacturing and mining firms are listed by cities and towns with specific information on each firm's operations. In these primary city-town listings , data are given on employment, date of establishment in Georgia, products, and, in most instances, names of owners, managers, purchasing agents, or other officials of the firm. Two indexes provide listings of firms by (1) types of products manufactured, as classified under the Standard Industrial Classification and (2 ) firm name. In addition. there are general subject and location indexes.

Never before has there ever been an attempt to provide as comprehensive information on Georgia industries as is given in this directory. The work of compilation has required more than a year' s effort by the Industrial Development Branch of the Georgia Tech Engineering Experiment Station. Dr . George 1. Whitlatch, Senior Research Scientist, served as project director, and he was ably assisted by Roy Cooper, Administrative Assistant, Timothy Singleton, Roger Sund, and Robert Lewis, Research Assistants.

Much credit is due the Georgia Power Company for the assistance given in checking individual town listings through their local offices. Without that help, this directory would not have been possible, and we extend to the Georgia Power Company and its personnel our sincere appreciation for their assistance. Grateful acknowledgment also is due the many company officials, plant owners, local Chambers of Commerce, bankers, state agencies, public officials, trade organizations, newspapers, and private cit izens who have so cordially assisted in providing information and in checking data on the industries in their respective areas.

The information for this directory has been obtained directly from the industries and/or from responsible local sources and every care has been exercised to insure accuracy, but both the compilers and the publisher recognize that errors - both factual and typographical - are certain to occur in a publication of this magnitude. Further, some companies undoubtedly have been omitted, due possibly to their failure to reply to the Georgia Tech inquiry for information and/or to inadequate checking of town or city listings by local sources. It will be appreciated, therefore, if such errors and omissions are brought to our attention. We shall endeavor to correct them in the next edition and apologize now for their occurrence in the present edition.

JACK J. MINTER, Director Georgia Department of Commerce

KENNETH C. WAGNER, Head Industrial Development Branch Engineering Experiment Station Georgia Institute of Technology

EXPLANATION OF LISTINGS

Listing by Location: F irms are alphabetically listed under the city or town in which each is located, with street address for those in the larger cities; in numerous instances, post office box number also is given. The number of employees is indicated by a code letter (see code below) listed parenthetically after the firm name, as (A) . Also included as a part of each listing is the date the firm was established in Georgia, its chief products, and the name of an offici al of the firm, as well as that of the purchasing agent where applicable. Population figures for 1960 follow the name of each city, but for towns of less than 1,000 population, the 1950 Census figures are used unle ss marked by an asterisk to denote use of 1960 data.

Listing by Produ cts: All firms in this section are grouped in accordance with the numerical code of the Standard Industrial Classification Manual of the U. S. Bureau of the Budget. Th e SIC groupings are in numerical sequence, with firm s listed under their respective cities and towns arranged in alphabetical order.

Firm Name Index: In this third section, all firms are alphabetically listed, with the town s and cities in which they are located.

Loca tion Index: Thi s section alphabetically indexes all towns and cities listed in this directory.

Subject Ind ex: Specific products included in the second section are broadly classified under an alphabetical listing in this index. This permits ready reference to the proper SIC grouping which, in turn, allows direct reference to the prim ary listing by city or town .
